sentences.en: A small, unobtrusive smile curved the cook's thin lips.
sentences.cn: 厨师的薄唇一弯，露出一丝不易察觉的微笑。

sentences.en: A thin curl of smoke rose from a rusty stove.
sentences.cn: 生锈的炉子里冒出一缕青烟。

sentences.en: a thin gold chain
sentences.cn: 一条细细的金链

sentences.en: A thin wisp of smoke straggled up through the trees.
sentences.cn: 一缕轻烟在林间袅袅升起。

sentences.en: A thin, glistening thread of moisture ran along the rough concrete sill.
sentences.cn: 在粗糙不平的水泥窗台上有一条细细的发光水印。

sentences.en: Don’t cut the bread so thin.
sentences.cn: 别把面包切得这么薄。

sentences.en: He was a tall, thin fellow with a slight stoop.
sentences.cn: 他是个瘦高个儿，有点驼背。

sentences.en: He was a tall, thin man with grey hair.
sentences.cn: 他是个瘦高个，头发灰白。

sentences.en: His legs were pitifully thin compared to the rest of his bulk.
sentences.cn: 他的双腿和他庞大身躯的其他部分相比瘦得可怜。

sentences.en: It would have been better to have thinned the trees over several winters rather than all at one time.
sentences.cn: 当初要是分几个冬天来疏剪树木，会比一次性疏剪要更好些。

sentences.en: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.cn: 北约将继续裁军。

sentences.en: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.cn: 北约将继续裁军。

sentences.en: She had pale thin yellow hair she pulled back into a bun.
sentences.cn: 她把一头稀疏的浅黄色头发向后梳，挽成了个圆髻。

sentences.en: She is too thin. Feed her up a bit.
sentences.cn: 她太瘦了，把她养胖点。

sentences.en: she just vanished &B{into thin air}.
sentences.cn: 她消失得无影无踪。

sentences.en: She suggests that women are under constant pressure to be abnormally thin.
sentences.cn: 她暗示说女性总是处在保持身材异常瘦削的压力之下。

sentences.en: She swathed her enormous body in thin black fabrics.
sentences.cn: 她用薄薄的黑色织物裹住了自己硕大的身躯。

sentences.en: She was thin and spare, with a sharply intelligent face.
sentences.cn: 她又高又瘦，一副精明过人的模样。

sentences.en: She’s only wearing a thin summer jacket (= a jacket made of light material ) .
sentences.cn: 她只穿了一件薄薄的夏装外套。

sentences.en: The air was thin and crisp, filled with hazy sunshine and frost.
sentences.cn: 空气稀薄清新，其间日光蒙眬，寒气逼人。

sentences.en: The ideas seem sketchily developed, the textures thin, the images vague.
sentences.cn: 观点阐述不充分，结构单薄，意象也模糊不清。

sentences.en: The road was covered with a thin layer of ice.
sentences.cn: 路面上覆盖着一层薄薄的冰。

sentences.en: The skin on the eyelids is the thinnest on the body.
sentences.cn: 眼睑上的皮肤是人体最薄的皮肤。

sentences.en: They have to be thin, attractive and well-dressed to boot.
sentences.cn: 她们必须得既苗条又迷人，而且一定要打扮漂亮。

sentences.en: they seemed to pluck numbers &B{out of thin air}.
sentences.cn: 他们似乎在凭空拨弄是非。

sentences.en: two thin slices of bread
sentences.cn: 薄薄的两片面包

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)（多指社会动荡环境下的）警察
无影无踪，了无踪影；不存在
瘦客户机；瘦客户端；精简型电脑
薄层色谱；薄层色谱法；薄层层析法
薄板；极薄的金属板混响；薄钢板
不畏艰险；在任何情况下

trans.tran_en: if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
Thin out means the same as
if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
Thin out means the same as
